materials.raw_text: B4: 20 g, Ca: 5 g, Nb: 50 g, Ru: 100 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; Ca (Calcium powder) - Chemical supply store; Nb (Niobium powder) - Specialized metal supplier; Ru (Ruthenium powder) - Precious metal supplier.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; Ca (Calcium powder) - Chemical supply store; Nb (Niobium powder) - Specialized metal supplier; Ru (Ruthenium powder) - Precious metal supplier.

1. Measure out 20 g of Boron powder. 2. Measure out 5 g of Calcium powder. 3. Measure out 50 g of Niobium powder. 4. Measure out 100 g of Ruthenium powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry container. 6. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or ball mill for 30 minutes to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 20 g of Boron powder. 2. Measure out 5 g of Calcium powder. 3. Measure out 50 g of Niobium powder. 4. Measure out 100 g of Ruthenium powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry container. 6. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or ball mill for 30 minutes to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1500 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Heat the crucible in the furnace for 2 hours to allow for solid-state reaction and material formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1500 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Heat the crucible in the furnace for 2 hours to allow for solid-state reaction and material formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Ensure no rapid cooling occurs to avoid cracking the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Ensure no rapid cooling occurs to avoid cracking the material.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file or sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant for protection if the material will be exposed to the environment. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, controlled environment.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file or sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant for protection if the material will be exposed to the environment. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, controlled environment.
